title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Cedric Vidonne. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: unhcrthemes: UNHCR Data Visualization Guidelines Recommendations with ggplot2
Authors and Citation
text: Cédric Vidonne. Author, maintainer. Ahmadou Dicko. Author. . Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Vidonne C, Dicko (2023). unhcrthemes: UNHCR 'ggplot2' Theme Colour Palettes. https://github.com/unhcr-dataviz/unhcrthemes, https://unhcr-dataviz.github.io/unhcrthemes/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {unhcrthemes: UNHCR `ggplot2` Theme and Colour Palettes},   author = {Cédric Vidonne and Ahmadou Dicko},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/unhcr-dataviz/unhcrthemes, https://unhcr-dataviz.github.io/unhcrthemes/}, }

title: UNHCR `ggplot2` Theme and Colour Palettes
text: Simplify data visualizations creation unhcrthemes R package, designed align plots UNHCR’s data visualization recommendations. package offers comprehensive ggplot2 theme, including built-customizations thoughtfully crafted color palettes.

title: UNHCR `ggplot2` Theme and Colour Palettes
text: consistent appealing ggplot2 theme matches UNHCR Data Visualization Guidelines. collection color palettes ensure plots consistent UNHCR’s color scheme. Easy--use functions apply theme color palettes ggplot2 plots.

title: UNHCR `ggplot2` Theme and Colour Palettes
text: Get started installing unhcrthemes package GitHub using pak library:
code: # If pak is not yet installed, uncomment the following line: # install.packages("pak")  pak::pkg_install("unhcr-dataviz/unhcrthemes")

title: UNHCR `ggplot2` Theme and Colour Palettes
code: # Apply the theme_unhcr() to your plot ggplot(   mtcars,   aes(x = hp, y = mpg) ) +   geom_point() +   labs(     title = "Simple scatterplot with ggplot",     subtitle = "This plot shows the default style of theme_unhcr()",     x = "Horsepower (hp)",     y = "Fuel efficiency (mpg)",     caption = "Source: mtcars"   ) +   theme_unhcr()

title: UNHCR `ggplot2` Theme and Colour Palettes
text: One two officially recommended fonts outlined UNHCR Data Visualization Guidelines Lato. ensure optimal functionality unhcrthemes package, please make sure Lato font installed device prior usage.

title: UNHCR `ggplot2` Theme and Colour Palettes
text: Choose variety carefully curated color palettes harmonize UNHCR’s visual identity.
code: # Display all unhcr color palette display_unhcr_all() # Or select a specific one and limit the number of colors display_unhcr_pal(n = 3, "pal_blue")

title: UNHCR `ggplot2` Theme and Colour Palettes
code: # Add color scale to your plot ggplot(   mtcars,   aes(x = hp, y = mpg, color = as.factor(cyl)) ) +   geom_point() +   labs(     title = "Simple scatterplot with ggplot",     subtitle = "This plot shows the default style of theme_unhcr()",     x = "Horsepower (hp)",     y = "Fuel efficiency (mpg)",     color = "Number of cylinder",     caption = "Source: mtcars"   ) +   scale_color_unhcr_d() +   theme_unhcr(legend_title = TRUE)

title: UNHCR `ggplot2` Theme and Colour Palettes
text: Explore examples unhcrthemes action package vignette UNHCR Data Visualization Platform.
code: # Add geom_text to the plot dplyr::count(mpg, class) |>   dplyr::arrange(n) |>   dplyr::mutate(class = factor(class, levels = class)) |>   ggplot(aes(n, class)) +   geom_col(fill = unhcr_pal(n = 1, "pal_blue")) +   geom_text(aes(label = n), hjust = 0, nudge_x = 1) +   labs(     title = "Simple bar chart with labels using ggplot",     subtitle = "This plot shows the default style of theme_unhcr()",     caption = "Source: mtcars"   ) +   scale_x_continuous(expand = expansion(c(0, 0.1))) +   theme_unhcr(grid = FALSE, axis = "y", axis_title = FALSE, axis_text = "y")

title: UNHCR `ggplot2` Theme and Colour Palettes
text: {refugees}: comprehensive package accessing UNHCR Refugee Population Statistics Database. {unhcrdown}: UNHCR branded templates R Markdown. quarto-revealjs-unhcr: Quarto extension create UNHCR branded reveal.js presentations. quarto-html-unhcr: Quarto extension create UNHCR branded HTML document. Data Visualization Platform: collection recommendations chart type selection, general dataviz design, tools tutorials showcase data visualization products made UNHCR.

title: UNHCR color palettes viewer — display_unhcr_all
text: Displays set color palettes UNHCR color

title: UNHCR color palettes viewer — display_unhcr_all
text: n Number different colors palette, minimum depending palette (2), maximum depending palette (5, 7 10) type Type palette, can "sequential", "diverging", "qualitative" ""

title: UNHCR color palettes viewer — display_unhcr_all
code: library(unhcrthemes) display_unhcr_all()  display_unhcr_all(type = "diverging")  display_unhcr_all(type = c("diverging", "qualitative", "sequential"))  display_unhcr_all(3, type = "sequential")  display_unhcr_all(5, type = "sequential")

title: UNHCR color palette viewer — display_unhcr_pal
text: Displays color palette UNHCR brand color

title: UNHCR color palette viewer — display_unhcr_pal
text: n Number different colors palette, minimum depending palette (2), maximum depending palette (5, 7 10) name palette name

title: UNHCR ggplot2 theme — theme_unhcr
text: theme_unhcr provides basic UNHCR theme use ggplot2 commands.

title: UNHCR ggplot2 theme — theme_unhcr
code: theme_unhcr(   font_family = "Lato",   font_size = 12,   plot_title_size = rel(1.35),   plot_title_margin = font_size,   subtitle_size = font_size,   subtitle_margin = font_size * 1.5,   strip_text_size = rel(0.9),   strip_text_face = "bold",   strip_text_just = 0,   caption_size = rel(0.7),   caption_margin = font_size,   axis_text = TRUE,   axis_text_size = rel(0.9),   axis_title = TRUE,   axis_title_size = rel(0.9),   axis = FALSE,   axis_ticks = FALSE,   grid = "XY",   legend = TRUE,   legend_text_size = rel(0.9),   legend_title = FALSE,   legend_title_size = rel(0.9),   plot_margin = margin(font_size, font_size, font_size, font_size),   plot_background = "#ffffff",   void = FALSE )

title: UNHCR ggplot2 theme — theme_unhcr
text: font_family Base font family "Lato". need "Lato" font installed device order use . font_size Base font size pt. Default 12 pts. plot_title_size Plot title font size. Default font_size * 1.35. plot_title_margin Plot title bottom margin. Default font_size. subtitle_size Plot subtitle font size. Default font_size. subtitle_margin Plot subtitle bottom margin. Default font_size * 1.5. strip_text_size Facet label font size. Default font_size * 0.9. strip_text_face Facet label font face. Default "bold". strip_text_just Facet label justification. Default 0. caption_size Caption font size. Default font_size * 0.7. caption_margin Caption top margin. Default font_size. axis_text Logical TRUE/FALSE xy. Turn axis label. Use x y correspondent active. Default TRUE. axis_text_size Axis label font size. Default font_size * 0.9. axis_title Logical TRUE/FALSE xy. Turn axis title. Use x y correspondent active. Default TRUE. axis_title_size Axis title font size. Default font_size * 0.9. axis Logical TRUE/FALSE xy. Turn axis. Use x y correspondent axis active. forget review expand argument scale_x_*/scale_y_* avoid spacing axis baseline plot. Default FALSE. axis_ticks Logical TRUE/FALSE xy. Turn axis ticks. Use x y correspondent axis ticks active. Default FALSE. grid Logical TRUE/FALSE combination X x Y y. Turn panel grids. Use XorYfor major grids, andxoryfor minor grid.  Default toXY`. legend Logical TRUE/FALSE. Turn legend. Default TRUE. legend_text_size Legend key font size. Default font_size * 0.9. legend_title Logical TRUE/FALSE. Turn legend title. Default FALSE. legend_title_size Legend title font size. Default font_size * 0.9. plot_margin Plot margin (specify ggplot2::margin()). Default ggplot2::margin(font_size, font_size, font_size, font_size). plot_background Plot background. Put "transparent" background color. Default "white". void Logical TRUE/FALSE. TRUE, grid lines, ticks axes removed. Default FALSE.

title: UNHCR ggplot2 theme — theme_unhcr
text: theme style

title: UNHCR ggplot2 theme — theme_unhcr
code: if (FALSE) { library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy)) +   geom_point() +   theme_unhcr() }

title: UNHCR color palettes — unhcr_pal
text: Creates color palette UNHCR branding

title: UNHCR color palettes — unhcr_pal
text: n Number different colors palette, minimum depending palette (2), maximum depending palette (5, 7 10) name palette name ... Additional arguments grDevices::colorRampPalette

title: UNHCR color palettes — unhcr_pal
text: character vector

title: UNHCR ggplot2 color scales — scale_color_unhcr_c
text: UNHCR ggplot2 color scales

title: UNHCR ggplot2 color scales — scale_color_unhcr_c
code: scale_color_unhcr_c(   ...,   type = "sequential",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   na.value = "#E9E9E9",   guide = "colourbar" )  scale_color_unhcr_d(   ...,   type = "qualitative",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   nmax = NULL,   order = NULL,   na.value = "#E9E9E9" )  scale_color_unhcr_b(   ...,   type = "qualitative",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   nmax = NULL,   order = NULL,   na.value = "#E9E9E9",   guide = "coloursteps" )  scale_colour_unhcr_c(   ...,   type = "sequential",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   na.value = "#E9E9E9",   guide = "colourbar" )  scale_colour_unhcr_d(   ...,   type = "qualitative",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   nmax = NULL,   order = NULL,   na.value = "#E9E9E9" )  scale_colour_unhcr_b(   ...,   type = "qualitative",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   nmax = NULL,   order = NULL,   na.value = "#E9E9E9",   guide = "coloursteps" )  scale_fill_unhcr_c(   ...,   type = "sequential",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   na.value = "#E9E9E9",   guide = "colourbar" )  scale_fill_unhcr_d(   ...,   type = "qualitative",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   nmax = NULL,   order = NULL,   na.value = "#E9E9E9" )  scale_fill_unhcr_b(   ...,   type = "qualitative",   palette = 1,   direction = 1,   nmax = NULL,   order = NULL,   na.value = "#E9E9E9",   guide = "coloursteps" )

title: UNHCR ggplot2 color scales — scale_color_unhcr_c
text: ... arguments passed discrete_scale() continuous_scale() control name, limits, breaks, labels forth type One \"sequential\", \"diverging\" \"qualitative\" palette string, use named palette. number, index list palettes appropriate type direction Sets order colors scale. 1, default, colors output unhcr_pal(). -1, order colors reversed na.value Missing values replaced value. guide function used create guide name. See guides() information. nmax Maximum number different colors palette contain. provided, calculated automatically data. order Numeric vector listing order colors used. Default 1:nmax.

title: UNHCR ggplot2 color scales — scale_color_unhcr_c
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(msleep, aes(vore, sleep_total, fill = vore)) +         geom_boxplot() +         scale_fill_unhcr_d(palette = 1, direction = -1)
